definition: to leave office/to leave one's post
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: In mid-month, Ken Starr announced he was stepping down.
sentences.chinese: 中旬，斯塔爾宣佈即將離任。

sentences.english: Ms Blears pointedly refused to say a good word about the prime minister as she resigned.
sentences.chinese: 她在離任時曾很決絕的拒絕對首相發表一句讚美之詞。

sentences.english: Ablett will depart after the International Cor Groenewegen Tournament in Holland this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 阿布萊特將在本月結束後離任。

sentences.english: Where a diplomat stationed abroad leaves his post and returns to his country, his rank shall be terminated correspondingly.
sentences.chinese: 駐外外交人員離任回國，其銜級相應終止。

sentences.english: First, though, Mr Musharraf should go.
sentences.chinese: 但是，穆沙拉夫應該離任。
歡歡是即將離任和熱情。

sentences.english: Railways ministry spokesman dismissed from office.
sentences.chinese: 鐵道部發言人王勇平離任。

sentences.english: Make sure this person completes his or her tasks before leaving.
sentences.chinese: 確保離任者離開以前完成了他或她的工作。

sentences.english: Mr Wolfowitz will leave the post at the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾弗維茨將於六月底離任。

sentences.english: The bank has apologised to Mr Herr-mann, who is no longer on the supervisory board.
sentences.chinese: 該行已向目前已從監事會離任的赫爾曼致歉。

sentences.english: Any outgoing local official had to make a check on the cypresses and go through a transfer procedure.
sentences.chinese: 地方官員離任時，都要點清古柏並辦理交接手續。

sentences.english: Mr. Tpowerfulg is nearly sixty years old. He is powerful outgoing principle.
sentences.chinese: 唐先生近六十歲，他是位行將離任的校長。

sentences.english: Nineteen months later, Yu was gone.
The departed Mr Lanci seems to have thought that tablets were a fad that would quickly fade.
sentences.chinese: 已經離任的蘭奇似乎認爲平板電腦只是一時風尚。

sentences.english: After leaving his professor post he probably went west to Jingxiang.
sentences.chinese: 其離任廬州教授後，很可能即西去荊襄。

sentences.english: Cabinet members are required to disclose family financial assets first when they take office, and later when they leave.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，內閣成員在就職及離任時均須申報家庭財產。

definition: to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to ask sb to resign from a post
to swear the oath of office
vice-president
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
by-election
reelection/to reelect
ruling class/leaders (of society)/oligarchy
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
World Health Organization (WHO)/abbr. for 世界衛生組織|世界卫生组织[Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1]
presidential election
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
executive
Secretary of State
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
committee meeting
